destinations.name: Isle of Skye
destinations.description: The Isle of Skye, connected to Scotland's northwest coast by bridge, is known for its rugged landscapes, picturesque fishing villages and medieval castles.

destinations.name: Edinborough
destinations.description: Edinburgh is Scotland's compact, hilly capital.

destinations.name: Glasgow
destinations.description: Glasgow is a port city on the River Clyde in Scotland's western Lowlands.

destinations.name: Mestia
destinations.description: Mestia is a highland townlet in northwest Georgia, at an elevation of 1,500 metres in the Caucasus Mountains.

destinations.name: Stepansminda
destinations.description: Stepantsminda, is a townlet in the Mtskheta-Mtianeti region of north-eastern Georgia.

destinations.name: Tibilisi
destinations.description: Tbilisi is the capital of the country of Georgia.

destinations.name: Vardzia
destinations.description: Vardzia is a cave monastery site in southern Georgia.

destinations.name: Zugdidi
destinations.description: Zugdidi is a city in the Western Georgian historical province of Samegrelo.

destinations.name: Kutaisi
destinations.description: Kutaisi is a city in west Georgia. It's home to the centuries-old Bagrati Cathedral.

destinations.name: Ananuri
destinations.description: Ananuri is a castle complex on the Aragvi River in Georgia, about 45 miles from Tbilisi.

destinations.name: Anaklia
destinations.description: Anaklia is a town and seaside resort in western Georgia.

destinations.name: Prague
destinations.description: Prague, capital city of the Czech Republic, is bisected by the Vltava River.

destinations.name: Lisbon
destinations.description: Lisbon is Portugal’s hilly, coastal capital city.

destinations.name: Lübeck
destinations.description: Lübeck is a northern German city distinguished by Brick Gothic architecture, which dates to its time as the medieval capital of the Hanseatic League, a powerful trading confederation.

destinations.name: Schwerin
destinations.description: Schwerin is the capital and second-largest city of the northeastern German state of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern.

destinations.name: Dresden
destinations.description: Dresden, capital of the eastern German state of Saxony, is distinguished by the celebrated art museums and classic architecture of its reconstructed old town.

destinations.name: Liverpool
destinations.description: Liverpool is a maritime city in northwest England, where the River Mersey meets the Irish Sea.

destinations.name: Manchester
destinations.description: Manchester is a major city in the northwest of England with a rich industrial heritage.

destinations.name: London
destinations.description: DescriptionLondon, the capital of England and the United Kingdom, is a 21st-century city with history stretching back to Roman times.

destinations.name: Leeds
destinations.description: Manchester is a major city in the northwest of England with a rich industrial heritage.

destinations.name: Kufstein
destinations.description: Kufstein is a town in the western Austrian province of Tyrol.

destinations.name: Wałbrzych
destinations.description: Wałbrzych is a city in Lower Silesian Voivodeship in southwestern Poland. From 1975–1998 it was the capital of Wałbrzych Voivodeship; it is now the seat of Wałbrzych County.

destinations.name: Wrocław
destinations.description: Wrocław is a city on the Oder River in western Poland. It’s known for its Market Square, lined with elegant townhouses and featuring a modern fountain.

destinations.name: Poznań
destinations.description: Poznań is a city on the Warta River in western Poland.

destinations.name: Piła
destinations.description: Piła is a town in northwestern Poland situated in the Greater Poland Voivodeship, previously capital of Piła Voivodeship.

destinations.name: Łódź
destinations.description: Łódź is a city in central Poland, known as a former textile-manufacturing hub.

destinations.name: Kraków
destinations.description: Kraków, a southern Poland city near the border of the Czech Republic, is known for its well-preserved medieval core and Jewish quarter.

destinations.name: Gdańsk
destinations.description: Gdańsk (Danzig in German) is a port city on the Baltic coast of Poland.

destinations.name: Sieradów Zdrój
destinations.description: Świeradów-Zdrój is a spa town in Lubań County, Lower Silesian Voivodeship, in south-western Poland near the border with the Czech Republic.

destinations.name: Katowice
destinations.description: Katowice is a city in southern Poland.
